meanings.definition: Having only one copy of a particular gene instead of the usual two
meanings.sent1: The hemizygous trait in the flower made it unique among the others.
meanings.sent2: The hemizygous condition in the bird affected its feather color.
meanings.sent3: The hemizygous gene in the fish caused it to swim sideways, looking like a dance move.
meanings.sent4: The hemizygous nature of the tree's leaves gave it a sparse, delicate appearance.
meanings.sent5: The hemizygous characteristic of the cat's fur made it stand out in the litter.

meanings.definition: Referring to an individual organism that carries a single copy of a particular gene on one of its sex chromosomes
meanings.sent1: The hemizygous feature in the butterfly's DNA affected its wing pattern.
meanings.sent2: The hemizygous trait in the beetle influenced its behavior during mating season.
meanings.sent3: The hemizygous gene in the frog made it croak in a unique rhythm.
meanings.sent4: The hemizygous characteristic of the lizard's scales gave it a shimmering appearance under the sun.
meanings.sent5: The hemizygous condition of the dog's coat made it a sought-after breed.
